Name: The Clinical and Immunological Investigations of Subtypes of Autism
Acknowledgements: These data were collected through the generous donation of time by the children and their families and the contributions of many NIH research assistants, post-doctoral fellows, and staff members, as well as extramural collaborators.
HowToAcknowledge: Please acknowledge us as follows: Data from the Clinical and Immunological Investigations of Subtypes of Autism study (NCT00298246) were obtained from the National Institute of Mental Health Data Archive (NDA). Please also cite: Raznahan A, Lenroot R, Thurm A, Gozzi M, Hanley A, Spence SJ, Swedo SE, Giedd JN. Mapping cortical anatomy in preschool aged children with autism using surface-based morphometry. Neuroimage Clin. 2012 Oct 31;2:111-9. doi: 10.1016/j.nicl.2012.10.005.
EthicsApprovals: Approved by the NIH Institutional Review Board (protocol 06-M-0102), NCT00298246 .

GeneratedBy.Name: dcm2niix
GeneratedBy.Description: Dcm2Bids used dcm2niix under the hood to convert DICOM to NIfTI images.

GeneratedBy.Name: Dcm2Bids
GeneratedBy.Description: Used for conversion of DICOM data into BIDS formatted tree.

GeneratedBy.Name: @afni_refacer_run
GeneratedBy.Description: AFNI's @afni_refacer_run program was used to deface most recently acquired T1w images in a session.

GeneratedBy.Name: FSL FLIRT
GeneratedBy.Description: FSL FLIRT program was used to register the most recently aquired T1w image in a session to each of the other scans available within the same session.

GeneratedBy.Name: FSLeyes
GeneratedBy.Description: FSLeyes was used to manually deface scans that couldn't be satisfactorily defaced programmatically.

GeneratedBy.Name: DSST Defacing Pipeline
GeneratedBy.Description: Defacing workflow to deface anatomical scans, evaluate defacing accuracy and correct defacing that failed visual inspection.

GeneratedBy.Name: VisualQC
GeneratedBy.Description: VisualQC's vqcdeface and vqcalign utilities were used to visually inspect and rate individual scans in the dataset.
